result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason W. Sturdevant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jason W. Sturdevant is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jason W. Sturdevant was found guilty of Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 347.413(1).
  • Jason W. Sturdevant was found guilty of Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason W. Sturdevant

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from DOC
of right to seek postconviction relief

Defendant Jason W. Sturdevant in court with attorney Curtis Johnson.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court hears counsel re:  the agreement.  All agree to that agreement.  Court addresses defendant, conducts plea waiver colloquy.  Court questions Atty. Allen on his recommendation to dismiss count 1, Allen replies.  Court accepts the explanation and finds it is OK to dismiss Count 1, 2 & 3 of this case.  Court advises of charges & penalties of Ct. 4 & 5.  Defendant pleads no contest to Counts 4 and 5.    Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently enters into the plea agreement and joint recommendation.  Court finds defendant guilty to Ct. 4 & 5; court hears counsel's comments.  Court addresses defendant and enters sentence as follows:  Court 4 - Sentence withheld, probation 2 years; Count 5 - Sentence withheld, probation 3 years, concurrent with each other.  Conditions:  30 days conditional jail time on each count concurrent to each other, reporting today by 6:00 pm, Huber granted.  Electronic monitoring may be used at the jail's discretion.  The jail is directed to calculate the credit for time served, and notify the Clerk's office within 10 days.  No costs ordered on Ct. 4, but on Count 5 - Costs of $443; lab costs of $40.50 to Iowa County Sheriff's Department.  Conditions as to both Count 4 and Count 5: AODA and follow through, Ignition interlock for 24 months after licensure, absolute sobriety, random UAs and PBT tests authorized; Counseling or other educational programs are ordered as requested by the agent;  No operating a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.   Court hears Atty Johnson re:  Firearms being held at sheriff's department; Atty. Allen may direct jail as to who purchases the firearms from the defendant, and the jail may release to the purchaser after Mr. Allen speaks with them.  Court admonishes defendant on felony and the rights removed.  Post conviction rights advised and form filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 6, 2017 at 09:30 am.
